description: Support to Government of Iraq in International Assistance Coordination and Capacity Building.

subproject.corporate outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to manage the equitable delivery of public services
subproject.description:
DMUs are established in designated Ministries, and respective employees are recruited/appointed and trained accordingly.
2-	Donor Assistance Databases are developed, installed, hosted and operational in six ministries and interconnected to enable data flow among them, as well as a comprehensive analysis of international assistance.
2.1- Establishment of Internet connectivity and local networking for designated Ministries
2.2 -- Development and installation of interactive web portals of the six Ministries for publishing key data and reports on international assistance  at National and   Ministerial levels, as appropriate, representing first/pilot steps in introduction of transparent and accountable e-government framework for Iraq.
3.1 - A framework and procedures are  designed on the use of DAD by the governorates and data management and supply from governorates to DAD
3.2-  Information Coordination Centre for data gathering and processing established and 25 university staff trained in data gathering and processing
3.3 Planning Centre for all 4 governorates of the Lower South (located in Basra) established. 12 local government staff from 4 LS governorates trained in information managements, analysis and planning.
subproject.title: Support to Government of Iraq

subproject.corporate outcome: Strengthened national-, regional- and local-level capacity to implement anti-corruption initiatives
